company.name: Global Data Vault, LLC
company.business_description: Global Data Vault provides data storage and recovery services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Global Data Vault, LLC claimed on its website that it participated in and complied with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework. However, after obtaining Privacy Shield certification in June 2017, the company failed to renew its certification when it expired in 2018, failed to complete required annual verification during its participation, and failed to affirm its commitment to continue protecting personal information after its certification lapsed. Despite Commerce warning the company to remove its Privacy Shield claims, it continued to falsely represent participation in the framework from July 2018 through May 2019.

representations_made.description: Claimed to comply with and participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: GDV complies with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information from European Union to the United States. GDV has certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles and accordingly is subject to the investigatory and enforcement powers of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC).

counts.title: Privacy Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it was a current participant in the EU-U.S Privacy Shield framework
counts.fact: After its certification lapsed, Respondent was not a current participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 15 is false or misleading.

counts.title: Misrepresentation Regarding Verification
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it complied with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield principles
counts.fact: Respondent failed to comply with the verification requirement during the time it participated in the program
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 17 is false or misleading.

counts.title: Misrepresentation Regarding Continuing Obligations
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it complied with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework principles, which include a requirement that if it ceased to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, it must affirm to Commerce that it will continue to apply the principles to personal information that it received during the time it participated in the program
counts.fact: Respondent did not affirm to Commerce that it will continue to apply the principles to personal information that it received during the time it participated in the program
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 19 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: Global Data Vault, LLC, a limited liability corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it participates in, adheres to, or is certified by any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in or compliance with privacy programs including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, and the APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

provisions.title: Requirement to Meet Continuing Obligations Under Privacy Shield
provisions.summary: Respondent must affirm to the Department of Commerce that it will continue to apply Privacy Shield principles to personal information or protect it by other authorized means, or alternatively return or delete the information.

requirements.description: Affirm to Department of Commerce within 10 days and annually thereafter that Respondent will continue to apply EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework principles to personal information received while participating in Privacy Shield
requirements.quoted_text: affirm to the Department of Commerce, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order and on an annual basis thereafter for as long as it retains such information, that it will continue to apply the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework principles to the personal information it received while it participated in the Privacy Shield

requirements.description: Or affirm to protect the information by another means authorized under EU law, including binding corporate rule or contract that fully reflects requirements of relevant standard contractual clauses adopted by the European Commission
requirements.quoted_text: affirm to the Department of Commerce, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order and on an annual basis thereafter for as long as it retains such information, that it will protect the information by another means authorized under EU law, including by using a binding corporate rule or a contract that fully reflects the requirements of the relevant standard contractual clauses adopted by the European Commission

requirements.description: Or return or delete the information within 10 days
requirements.quoted_text: return or delete the information within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit acknowledgment of receipt to the Commission, deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, and agents, and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For 10 years, deliver copy of Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities, agents and representatives, and any business entity resulting from structural changes - within 10 days for current personnel and before new personnel assume responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: For ten (10) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt from each individual or entity to which Order was delivered
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial compliance report within 60 days and compliance notices within 14 days of any changes to designated points of contact, business structure, or bankruptcy proceedings.

requirements.description: Submit compliance report sworn under penalty of perjury identifying contact information, all businesses, business activities, compliance with each provision, and copies of acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated point of contact or business structure
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of filing of bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding within 14 days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: All submissions sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746
requirements.quoted_text: Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: "I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____" and supplying the date, signatory's full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to Associate Director of Enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Global Data Vault, LLC, FTC File No. 1923093, Docket No. C-4706.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create certain records for 10 years after the Order issuance date and retain each record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, compliance records, and copies of representations.

requirements.description: Create accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold for 10 years and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must create certain records for ten (10) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold

requirements.description: Create personnel records showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title, dates of service, and reason for termination for each person providing services for 10 years and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination

requirements.description: Create all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of Order, including all submissions to the Commission, for 10 years and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission

requirements.description: Create a copy of each widely disseminated representation making any representation subject to Order and all materials relied upon in making the representation for 10 years and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, interviewing affiliated persons, and using other lawful means including posing as consumers or suppliers.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of written request from Commission representative, submit additional compliance reports or other requested information sworn under penalty of perjury and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: For matters concerning Order, Commission representatives are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent and Respondent must permit interviews of anyone affiliated who has agreed to interview
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: Commission may use all other lawful means including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other entities without necessity of identification or prior notice
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: Order is final and effective upon publication on FTC website and terminates on January 23, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date the U.S. or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the Order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon date of publication on ftc.gov as final order
requirements.quoted_text: this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order.

requirements.description: Order terminates on January 23, 2040, or 20 years from most recent date U.S. or Commission files complaint in federal court alleging violation, whichever comes later, with specified exceptions
requirements.quoted_text: This Order will terminate on January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
